title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@damurka.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Data Dimensions
text: Metadata DHIS2 refers predefined data dimensions provide context data values. context essential classifying, organizing, analyzing data, ultimately enabling better understanding information. main metadata dimensions DHIS2 include: Organisation Units: Provide geographical context data. Data Elements: Define measured. Periods: Specify temporal dimension data.

title: Data Dimensions
text: Organisation units DHIS2 represent location larger geographical context data. encompass: Locations services provided (e.g., health facilities, schools, community units). Administrative units representing geographical areas (e.g., district, county, sub-county). Kenya, hierarchy organisation units starts country level, subdivided 47 counties, smaller sub-counties wards. lowest level, individual health facilities community units, forming hierarchical tree. DHIS2 allows classification organisation units using criteria administrative hierarchy. can achieved use organisation unit groups organisation unit group sets. Organisation Unit Groups: Allow additional sub-classification organisation units (e.g., ownership facility level) geographical classification. Organisation Unit Group Sets: Serve umbrella classifications containing individual groups (e.g., Facility Type Organisation Unit Group Set contains Faith-based Organisation, Ministry Health, Private Facilities Organisation Unit Groups).
code: # Retrieves organisation unit groups which belong to the organisation  # unit group set with the name 'Facility Ownership' orgs_groups <- get_organisation_unit_groups(     groupSets.name %.eq% 'Facility Ownership' ) orgs_groups #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   name                                    id          #>   <chr>                                   <chr>       #> 1 Revised Faith Based Organisation (2018) eT1vvFVhLHc #> 2 Revised Ministry of Health (2018)       AaAF5EmS1fk #> 3 Revised NGO (2018)                      g58rumvciv2 #> 4 Revised Private(2018)                   aRxa6o8GqZN # Retrieves all the organisation unit group sets orgs_group_set <- get_organisation_unit_groupsets() orgs_group_set #> # A tibble: 20 × 2 #>    name                                           id          #>    <chr>                                          <chr>       #>  1 "ART Central Sites"                            tjVYz9cY7I3 #>  2 "ART Facility Type"                            IwvoiaXmT7G #>  3 "ASAL Counties"                                x8y86riED0O #>  4 "Beyond Zero Clinics"                          cUiz93K15ZU #>  5 "Facility Ownership"                           JlW9OiK1eR4 #>  6 "Facility Type"                                FSoqQFDES0U #>  7 "Health Facilities -Refugee Camp "             f0JZ8v0Zxa3 #>  8 "KEPH Level "                                  sytI3XYbxwE #>  9 "Malaria Endemic Zones"                        Qhu3PDob3X6 #> 10 "Malaria Epidemiological Zones"                IgwwNhbzeK7 #> 11 "Malaria Vaccine Lake Endemic"                 Vo3q0yjOYFv #> 12 "NASCOP Region"                                rbvYf4IjcGf #> 13 "Non-Refugee & Refugee camp Health facilities" ltZ6C4ckNLl #> 14 "Programme Sponsor"                            OE9Qlwr8XFv #> 15 "Province Name"                                A2DKecGXz73 #> 16 "Supply Chain"                                 Vww46znsPsj #> 17 "TB  Lab Subcounty Store Vers 2022"            gmsEbbTJReq #> 18 "TB SubCounty Stores"                          R0JQ0AqdsZf #> 19 "TB Zone"                                      jvksQn3RnbT #> 20 "Type details"                                 klLcxNWVo1q

title: Data Dimensions
text: Data elements DHIS2 define represented particular data value. act labels variables describing nature data. Examples include counts malaria cases number women screened. Data elements can represent numerical values can aggregated (summed averaged) monthly quarterly values. can also disaggregated (separated components) aggregated (summed) facility district country. Related data elements grouped logical collection referred data element groups. data element groups directly contain data reference members data elements. Therefore data element groups provide way manage analyze related data elements.
code: # Retrieves all the data elements in DHIS2 data_elements <- get_data_elements() data_elements #> # A tibble: 15,303 × 2 #>    name                                                                    id    #>    <chr>                                                                   <chr> #>  1 ""                                                                      ioUh… #>  2 "0000000 INCOME & EXPENDITURE STATEMENT"                                RvNJ… #>  3 "1000000 Income/Revenue"                                                zo5v… #>  4 "10.1 Residential"                                                      tZ3q… #>  5 "10.1 The facility has a sound fnancial plan that is adequately funded" oYdx… #>  6 "10.2 Commercial"                                                       PQNa… #>  7 "10.2 Financial resources are provided and used towards Quality Manage… OnDA… #>  8 "10.3 Availability of updated fee structure, strategically and promine… UXQg… #>  9 "10.3 Institutional"                                                    FGHs… #> 10 "10.4 Facility improvement/ Quality management funds are effciently us… y9ui… #> # ℹ 15,293 more rows # Retrieves all the data element groups data_element_groups <- get_data_element_groups() data_element_groups #> # A tibble: 259 × 2 #>    name                                           id          #>    <chr>                                          <chr>       #>  1 "706D Haemovigilance Tool"                     EvSFB0kFshj #>  2 "751_BFCI FORM "                               Q3ZqDNTgosn #>  3 "Adverse Events Following Immunization (AEFI)" zHoxBNmNfej #>  4 "AFP Smear"                                    jjm7ipMtusz #>  5 "AMR - Acinetobacter Isolates"                 uqIQDfIInK1 #>  6 "AMR - Escherichia coli isolates"              VjgPbuOqvBq #>  7 "AMR - Klebsiella species isolates"            SMINXpqL0s5 #>  8 "AMR - Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates"        NpOK7Em3QRk #>  9 "AMR - Staphylococcus aureus Isolates"         B3VgKffq78S #> 10 "Antenatal client first visits"                XTHYIz6qsdX #> # ℹ 249 more rows

title: Data Dimensions
text: Periods crucial factor collecting analyzing data time creating periodic reports. DHIS2 supports two types periods: Relative Periods: Defined relation date analysis (e.g., last year, last month, quarter). Fixed Periods: Refer specific periods (e.g., January 2024, 2020 2024). choice periods depends type insight needed, whether ’s specific point time, trend months, annual overview. details see Date Period Format DHIS2 utilizes multi-dimensional data model, allowing analyze data across various aspects like data elements, periods, organization units. flexibility empowers gain deeper insights answer complex questions.

title: Data Dimensions
text: good news , don’t necessarily need know intricate details every dimension item building analytics queries! khisr provides functions handle complexities .

title: Data Dimensions
text: deeper dives specific dimensions objects, refer comprehensive DHIS2 API documentation

title: Date and Period Format
text: DHIS2 allows define periods two ways: - Fixed Periods: Refer specific calendar periods (e.g., January 2024, 2020 2024). - Relative Periods: Defined relation current date (e.g., last year, last month, quarter).

title: Date and Period Format
text: period format described following table (also available [get_period_types()]):

title: Date and Period Format
text: can also utilize relative periods addition fixed periods (defined ). available relative period values : THIS_WEEK, LAST_WEEK, LAST_4_WEEKS, LAST_12_WEEKS, LAST_52_WEEKS, THIS_MONTH, LAST_MONTH, THIS_BIMONTH, LAST_BIMONTH, THIS_QUARTER, LAST_QUARTER, THIS_SIX_MONTH, LAST_SIX_MONTH, MONTHS_THIS_YEAR, QUARTERS_THIS_YEAR, THIS_YEAR, MONTHS_LAST_YEAR, QUARTERS_LAST_YEAR, LAST_YEAR, LAST_5_YEARS, LAST_10_YEARS, LAST_10_FINANCIAL_YEARS, LAST_12_MONTHS, LAST_3_MONTHS, LAST_6_BIMONTHS, LAST_4_QUARTERS, LAST_2_SIXMONTHS, THIS_FINANCIAL_YEAR, LAST_FINANCIAL_YEAR, LAST_5_FINANCIAL_YEARS

title: Getting Started
text: khisr prioritizes security operating authenticated mode default. ensures interact DHIS2 recognized user. begin exploring DHIS2 data, ’ll need establish credentials.

title: Getting Started
text: Obtain Credentials: Secure DHIS2 username password appropriate channels within DHIS2 organization. Store Credentials Securely: khisr offers convenient way store credentials within R environment. Refer comprehensive guide, Set Credentials, detailed instructions setting managing credentials effectively. Note: Replace placeholders like ‘-dhis2-username’ ‘path///secret.json’ actual credentials file path.
code: # Set the credentials using username and password khis_cred(username = 'your-dhis2-username', password = 'your-dhis2-password', server = 'https://<your dhis2 instance>')  # Set credentials using configuration path khis_cred(config_path = 'path/to/secret.json')

title: Getting Started
text: DHIS2 utilizes metadata define structure meaning data. Explore data dimensions resource deeper understanding.

title: Getting Started
text: khisr provides set high-level functions retrieve details various DHIS2 metadata categories. functions often leverage R IDE’s auto-complete feature faster typing. following table summarizes khisr metadata helper functions:

title: Getting Started
text: khisr allows filter retrieved metadata using straightforward approach. filter format follows pattern property:operator:value. ’s breakdown components: property: property metadata want filter . operator: comparison operator want perform (examples: eq equality, like case-sensitive string matching). value: value use comparison (required operators). following table provides summary supported operators:

title: Getting Started
text: Basic usage metadata filter
code: # Retrieve organisation units by county (level 2) county <- get_organisation_units(level %.eq% '2') county #> # A tibble: 47 × 2 #>   name                   id          #>   <chr>                  <chr>       #> 1 Baringo County         vvOK1BxTbet #> 2 Bomet County           HMNARUV2CW4 #> 3 Bungoma County         KGHhQ5GLd4k #> 4 Busia County           Tvf1zgVZ0K4 #> 5 Elgeyo Marakwet County MqnLxQBigG0 #> # ℹ 42 more rows  # Retrieve county by name (Mombasa) county <- get_organisation_units(level %.eq% '2',                                  name %.like% 'mombasa') county #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   name           id          #>   <chr>          <chr>       #> 1 Mombasa County wsBsC6gjHvn  data_element_id <- c('cXe64Yk0QMY', 'XEX93uLsAm2')  # Retrieve data elements by ID using operator in data_elements <- get_data_elements(id %.in% data_element_id) data_elements #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   name         id          #>   <chr>        <chr>       #> 1 CBE-Abnormal XEX93uLsAm2 #> 2 CBE-Normal   cXe64Yk0QMY  # Retrieve data elements by filtering using dataElementGroups data_elements <- get_data_elements(dataElementGroups.name %.like% 'moh 705') data_elements #> # A tibble: 96 × 2 #>   name                        id          #>   <chr>                       <chr>       #> 1 Abortion                    IrWSgk9GsUm #> 2 All other diseases          KxT47tbKHsd #> 3 Anaemia cases               kkUHOwGMawD #> 4 Arthritis, Joint pains etc. waNhWrS3HL6 #> 5 Asthma                      L82lvvxVaqt #> # ℹ 91 more rows

title: Getting Started
text: analytics resource DHIS2 empowers access analyze aggregated data across various dimensions. effectively leverage resource, let’s explore key functions parameters involved:

title: Getting Started
text: get_analytics(): Retrieves aggregated data based specified dimensions filters. analytics_dimension(): Constructs dimensions queries, ensuring accurate data retrieval. %.d% (infix operator): Convenient shorthand creating dimension filters. %.f% (infix operator): Convenient shorthand creating filter dimensions.

title: Getting Started
text: dimension query parameter defines dimensions included analytics query. number dimensions can specified. dimension parameter repeated dimension include query response. query response can potentially contain aggregated values combinations specified dimension items. fixed dimensions data element (dx) period (time) (pe) organisation unit (ou) dimension. can dynamically add dimensions categories, data element group sets organisation unit group sets.

title: Getting Started
text: filter parameter defines dimensions used filters data retrieved analytics query. number filters can specified. filter parameter repeated filter use query. filter differs dimension filter dimensions part query response content, aggregated values response collapsed filter dimensions. words, data response aggregated filter dimensions, filters included dimensions actual response.

title: Getting Started
text: Specify Dimensions: Use dimensions parameter define dimensions want include query response. Leverage infix operators %.d% concise readable code. Apply Filters: Use filters parameter specify dimensions filtering data without including response.
code: # To include a list dimensions for data elements id, dataset ids dx %.d% c('dimension-id-1', 'dimension-id-2') #> <spliced> #> $dimension #> [1] "dx:dimension-id-1;dimension-id-2"  pe %.d% 'LAST_YEAR' #> <spliced> #> $dimension #> [1] "pe:LAST_YEAR"  ou %.d% 'USER_ORGUNIT' #> <spliced> #> $dimension #> [1] "ou:USER_ORGUNIT"  # showing in the analytics get_analytics(     dx %.d% c('siOyOiOJpI8', 'Lt0FqtnHraW', 'OoakJhWiyZp'),     pe %.d% 'LAST_YEAR',     ou %.d% c('qKzosKQPl6G') ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   dx          pe    ou          value #>   <chr>       <chr> <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 OoakJhWiyZp 2023  qKzosKQPl6G  5092 #> 2 Lt0FqtnHraW 2023  qKzosKQPl6G 31101 #> 3 siOyOiOJpI8 2023  qKzosKQPl6G 20554  # Using the startDate and endDate with organisation unit keyword 'USER_ORGUNIT' get_analytics(     dx %.d% c('siOyOiOJpI8', 'Lt0FqtnHraW', 'OoakJhWiyZp'),     ou %.d% 'USER_ORGUNIT',     pe %.d% 'all',     startDate = '2023-07-01',     endDate = '2023-12-31' ) #> # A tibble: 18 × 4 #>   dx          ou          pe       value #>   <chr>       <chr>       <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 siOyOiOJpI8 HfVjCurKxh2 202310  752870 #> 2 siOyOiOJpI8 HfVjCurKxh2 202312  651287 #> 3 Lt0FqtnHraW HfVjCurKxh2 202307 1122436 #> 4 OoakJhWiyZp HfVjCurKxh2 202308  367190 #> 5 siOyOiOJpI8 HfVjCurKxh2 202311  671394 #> # ℹ 13 more rows # Filter by period pe %.f% 'LAST_YEAR' #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "pe:LAST_YEAR"  # Filter by organisation unit ou %.f% 'USER_ORGUNIT' #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "ou:USER_ORGUNIT"  # showing in the analytics. filter by organisation unit with id 'qKzosKQPl6G' # and period 'LAST_YEAR' get_analytics(     dx %.d% c('siOyOiOJpI8', 'Lt0FqtnHraW', 'OoakJhWiyZp'),     pe %.f% 'LAST_YEAR',     ou %.f% 'qKzosKQPl6G' ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   dx          value #>   <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 OoakJhWiyZp  5092 #> 2 siOyOiOJpI8 20554 #> 3 Lt0FqtnHraW 31101

title: Set your credentials
text: guide outlines set credentials accessing data DHIS2 instance. DHIS2 (District Health Information System 2) widely used open-source platform health data management.access data khisr package, need provide valid credentials. khisr package make calls DHIS2 without credentials, incorrect credentials result unauthorized error DHIS2. method recommended security reasons avoids storing credentials directly code. JSON file following format:
code: khis_cred(config_path = "/path/to/the/JSON/file.json") {   "credentials": {     "username": "your-dhis2-username",     "password": "your-dhis2-password",     "server": "https://<dhis2 api instance>"   } }

title: Set your credentials
text: use JSON file, can provide username password directly:
code: khis_cred(username = 'your_username', password = 'your_password', server = 'https://<dhis2 api instance>')

title: Set your credentials
text: khis_has_cred(): Confirms credentials set successfully. khis_username(): Retrieves username currently logged-user. khis_base_url(): Retrieve base url DHIS2 instance used khis_cred_clear(): Clears credentials currently logged-user.

what: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: khisr package designed seamlessly integrate DHIS2, providing R users powerful interface efficient data retrieval. DHIS2 cornerstone health information management many organisations, khisr simplifies process accessing working DHIS2 data directly within R environment.

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: Data Retrieval: Easily download manage data DHIS2. Flexible Queries: Customize data queries retrieve specific data elements, periods, organizational units. Secure Access: Manage credentials securely within R environment.

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: Health data analysis research. Monitoring evaluation health programs Generating reports dashboards health information systems.

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: can install release version khisr CRAN :
code: install.packages("khisr")

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: development version khisr like :
code: #install.packages('pak') pak::pak('damurka/khisr')

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
code: library("khisr")

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: khisr package operates authenticated mode default. means ’ll need provide credentials using functions interact DHIS2 instance download data. ensure secure access, khisr offers convenient way store credentials within R environment. Refer following resource detailed instructions setting credentials: set credentials ’ve established credentials, ’re ready leverage khisr’s functions download data DHIS2 instance. overview, ’ve logged DHIS2 specific user hidden chunk.
code: # Option 1: Set credentials directly in R (less secure)  khis_cred(username = 'DHIS2 username',            password = 'DHIS2 password',            server = 'https://<dhis2 server instance>')  # Option 2: Set credentials from a secure configuration file (recommended)  khis_cred(config_path = 'path/to/secret.json')

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: # Retrieve the organisation units by county (level 2) counties <- get_organisation_units(level %.eq% '2') counties #> # A tibble: 47 × 2 #>    name                   id          #>    <chr>                  <chr>       #>  1 Baringo County         vvOK1BxTbet #>  2 Bomet County           HMNARUV2CW4 #>  3 Bungoma County         KGHhQ5GLd4k #>  4 Busia County           Tvf1zgVZ0K4 #>  5 Elgeyo Marakwet County MqnLxQBigG0 #>  6 Embu County            PFu8alU2KWG #>  7 Garissa County         uyOrcHZBpW0 #>  8 Homa Bay County        nK0A12Q7MvS #>  9 Isiolo County          bzOfj0iwfDH #> 10 Kajiado County         Hsk1YV8kHkT #> # ℹ 37 more rows  # Retrieve organisation units by name (level included to ensure it refers to county) kiambu_county <- get_organisation_units(level %.eq% '2',                                          name %.like% 'Kiambu') kiambu_county  #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   name          id          #>   <chr>         <chr>       #> 1 Kiambu County qKzosKQPl6G  # Retrieve all data elements by data element group for outpatient (data element group name MOH 705) moh_705 <- get_data_elements(dataElementGroups.name %.like% 'moh 705') moh_705  #> # A tibble: 96 × 2 #>    name                         id          #>    <chr>                        <chr>       #>  1 Abortion                     IrWSgk9GsUm #>  2 All other diseases           KxT47tbKHsd #>  3 Anaemia cases                kkUHOwGMawD #>  4 Arthritis, Joint pains etc.  waNhWrS3HL6 #>  5 Asthma                       L82lvvxVaqt #>  6 Autism                       L529r3Wvtcf #>  7 Bilharzia  (Schistosomiasis) ojFSHMwbkHK #>  8 Brucellosis                  nb9cfWgxYFc #>  9 Burns                        dkEYL9Sous9 #> 10 Cardiovascular conditions    sZETzNe1To8 #> # ℹ 86 more rows  # Filter the data element to element that contain malaria malaria <- get_data_elements(dataElementGroups.name %.like% 'moh 705',                               name %.like% 'malaria') malaria  #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   name                                    id          #>   <chr>                                   <chr>       #> 1 Confirmed Malaria (only Positive cases) OoakJhWiyZp #> 2 Malaria in pregnancy                    gvZmXInRLuD #> 3 MOH 705A Rev 2020_ Tested for Malaria   siOyOiOJpI8 #> 4 Suspected  Malaria                      Lt0FqtnHraW  # Retrieve data for malaria in Kiambu county in the outpatient data element groups data <- get_analytics(         dx %.d% malaria$id,         pe %.d% 'LAST_YEAR',         ou %.f% kiambu_county$id     ) %>%     left_join(malaria, by = c('dx'='id')) data #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   dx          pe    value name                                    #>   <chr>       <chr> <dbl> <chr>                                   #> 1 Lt0FqtnHraW 2023  31101 Suspected  Malaria                      #> 2 OoakJhWiyZp 2023   5092 Confirmed Malaria (only Positive cases) #> 3 siOyOiOJpI8 2023  20554 MOH 705A Rev 2020_ Tested for Malaria   #> 4 gvZmXInRLuD 2023    397 Malaria in pregnancy

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2

title: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2
text: Please note khisr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Analytics Data Dimensions — analytics-dimension
text: Constructs dimensions expression analytics queries based specified property, operator, values.

title: Analytics Data Dimensions — analytics-dimension
code: analytics_dimension(property, operator, values)  operator %.d% values  operator %.f% values

title: Analytics Data Dimensions — analytics-dimension
text: property character string representing whether dimension filter. accepts 'dimension', 'filter'. operator character string representing property filter (e.g., 'dx', 'pe', 'ou'). values vector values semi-colon separated string items.

title: Analytics Data Dimensions — analytics-dimension
text: spliced list filter format property=operator:value

title: Analytics Data Dimensions — analytics-dimension
text: DHIS2 organizes data using multiple dimensions, unique identifier set items represent specific data points within dimension. Data elements (dx): Indicators, data set reporting rate metrics, data element operands, program indicators, program data elements, program attributes, validation rules. Periods (pe): ISO periods (e.g., 202401) relative periods (e.g., LAST_WEEK). Organisation unit hierarchy (ou): Specific health facilities, districts, countries, keywords user location sub-units. Category option combinations (co): Category option combo identifiers. Attribute option combinations (ao): Category option combo identifiers. Categories: Category option identifiers. Data element group sets: Data element group identifiers. Organisation unit group sets: Organisation unit group identifiers. infix operator used filter dimension includes: %.d%: Infix operator constructing dimension filters. Equivalent calling analytics_dimension("dimension", ...). %.f%: Infix operator constructing filter filters. Equivalent calling analytics_dimension("filter", ...).

title: Analytics Data Dimensions — analytics-dimension
code: # Create a dimension for data element "DE_1234" analytics_dimension('dimension', "dx", "DE_1234") #> <spliced> #> $dimension #> [1] "dx:DE_1234" #>   # Equivalent to the expression above dx %.d% "DE_1234" #> <spliced> #> $dimension #> [1] "dx:DE_1234" #>   # Create a filter dimension for the period of January 2024 pe %.f% "202401" #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "pe:202401" #>   # Create filter dimension for periods "202401" and "202402": analytics_dimension("filter", "pe", c("202401", "202402")) #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "pe:202401;202402" #>

what: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
title: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
text: get_analytics() retrieves disaggregated data DHIS2 analytics tables specified period data element(s), without performing aggregation.

title: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
code: get_analytics(   ...,   return_type = c("uid", "name"),   retry = 2,   verbosity = 0,   timeout = 60 )

title: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
text: ... One analytics_dimension() parameters key-value pairs. define analytics query, including data elements, periods, organization units. return_type Optional argument specifying return format identifiers. defaults 'uid'. Choose 'name' human readable labels. retry Number times retry API call case failure (defaults 2). verbosity Level HTTP information print call: 0: output 1: Show headers 2: Show headers bodies 3: Show headers, bodies, CURL status message. timeout Maximum number seconds wait API response.

title: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
text: tibble containing disaggregated analytics data, NULL data retrieved.

title: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
text: Retrieves data directly DHIS2 analytics tables. Allows specifying analytics dimensions, return format identifiers, retry attempts, logging verbosity.

title: Retrieves Disaggregated Analytics Data from DHIS2 — get_analytics
code: # Clinical Breast Examination data elements # XEX93uLsAm2 = CBE Abnormal # cXe64Yk0QMY = CBE Normal element_id <- c('cXe64Yk0QMY', 'XEX93uLsAm2')  # Download data from February 2023 to current date data <- get_analytics(dx %.d% element_id, pe %.d% 'LAST_MONTH') data #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   dx          pe     value #>   <chr>       <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 cXe64Yk0QMY 202409 35941 #> 2 XEX93uLsAm2 202409   425

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data — get_analytics_by_level

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data — get_analytics_by_level
code: get_analytics_by_level(   element_ids,   start_date,   end_date = NULL,   level = 1,   org_ids = NULL,   ...,   call = caller_env() )

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data — get_analytics_by_level
text: element_ids Required vector data element IDs retrieve data. start_date Required start date retrieve data. required format YYYY-MM-dd. end_date Optional ending date data retrieval (default current date). level desired organisation level data (default: level 1) org_ids Optional list organization units IDs filtered. ... options can passed onto DHIS2 API. call caller environment.

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data — get_analytics_by_level
text: tibble detailed information, including: Geographical identifiers (country, subnational, district, facility, depending level) Reporting period (month, year, fiscal year) Data element names Category options Reported values

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data — get_analytics_by_level
text: Retrieves data directly DHIS2 analytics tables. Supports optional arguments providing organization lists, data elements, categories. Allows specifying DHIS2 session objects, retry attempts, logging verbosity.

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data — get_analytics_by_level
code: # Clinical Breast Examination data elements # XEX93uLsAm2 = CBE Abnormal # cXe64Yk0QMY = CBE Normal element_id = c('cXe64Yk0QMY', 'XEX93uLsAm2')  # Download data from February 2023 to current date data <- get_analytics_by_level(element_ids = element_id,                                start_date = '2023-02-01') data #> # A tibble: 199 × 7 #>    value kenya element      category  period     month     year #>    <dbl> <chr> <chr>        <chr>     <date>     <ord>    <dbl> #>  1   137 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 35-39 yrs 2023-06-01 June      2023 #>  2    18 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 56-74 yrs 2024-04-01 April     2024 #>  3   156 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 35-39 yrs 2023-05-01 May       2023 #>  4    35 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 56-74 yrs 2024-05-01 May       2024 #>  5    24 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 56-74 yrs 2024-03-01 March     2024 #>  6   150 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 35-39 yrs 2023-07-01 July      2023 #>  7   100 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 35-39 yrs 2023-08-01 August    2023 #>  8   119 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 35-39 yrs 2023-04-01 April     2023 #>  9   116 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 35-39 yrs 2023-02-01 February  2023 #> 10    28 Kenya CBE-Abnormal 56-74 yrs 2024-08-01 August    2024 #> # ℹ 189 more rows

what: Retrieve the Configured DHIS2 API Base URL — khis_base_url
title: Retrieve the Configured DHIS2 API Base URL — khis_base_url
text: function returns base URL DHIS2 API provided auth object, falls back global auth credentials auth provided.

title: Retrieve the Configured DHIS2 API Base URL — khis_base_url
code: khis_base_url(auth = NULL)

title: Retrieve the Configured DHIS2 API Base URL — khis_base_url
text: auth (Optional) auth object containing DHIS2 credentials. provided, function retrieves base URL global auth object.

title: Retrieve the Configured DHIS2 API Base URL — khis_base_url
text: DHIS2 base URL string, NULL credentials available.

title: Retrieve the Configured DHIS2 API Base URL — khis_base_url
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # Set the credentials using the global .auth object     khis_cred(username = 'DHIS2 username',               password = 'DHIS2 password',               server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')      # Retrieve the DHIS2 instance API base URL (expect 'https://<dhis2-instance>')     khis_base_url()      # Clear credentials     khis_cred_clear()      # Retrieve the base URL again (expect 'NULL')     khis_base_url() } # }

title: Sets DHIS2 Credentials — khis_cred
text: khis_cred() sets credentials accessing DHIS2 instance.

title: Sets DHIS2 Credentials — khis_cred
code: khis_cred(   username = NULL,   password = NULL,   server = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   config_path = NULL,   base_url = deprecated() )

title: Sets DHIS2 Credentials — khis_cred
text: username DHIS2 username. required configuration file provided. password DHIS2 password. required configuration file provided. server server URL DHIS2 instance. required configuration file provided. api_version API version DHIS2 instance (optional). config_path optional path configuration file containing username password. considered secure providing credentials directly code. base_url Deprecated. base URL DHIS2 instance. Use server instead.

title: Sets DHIS2 Credentials — khis_cred
text: Auth object

title: Sets DHIS2 Credentials — khis_cred
text: function allows set credentials interacting DHIS2 server. can either provide username password directly (less secure) specify path configuration file containing credentials. Using configuration file recommended improved security prevents credentials stored directly code.

title: Sets DHIS2 Credentials — khis_cred
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # Option 1: Using a configuration file (recommended)     # Assuming a configuration file named "credentials.json":     khis_cred(config_path = "path/to/credentials.json")      # Option 2: Providing credentials directly (less secure)     khis_cred(username = "your_username",               password = "your_password",               server='https://<dhis2-instance>') } # }

text: return value, called side effects.

title: Clear the Credentials from Memory — khis_cred_clear
code: # Clear credentials from the global .auth object khis_cred_clear()

title: Retrieve the Configured Display Name — khis_display_name
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # Set the credentials using global .auth object     khis_cred(username = 'DHIS2 username',               password = 'DHIS2 password',               server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')      # Retrieve the display name from the global .auth profile     khis_display_name()      # Clear credentials     khis_cred_clear()      # Retrieve the display name again (expect 'NULL')     khis_display_name() } # }

what: Check if DHIS2 Credentials are Available — khis_has_cred
title: Check if DHIS2 Credentials are Available — khis_has_cred
text: function checks whether valid credentials available either provided auth object global auth credentials object.

title: Check if DHIS2 Credentials are Available — khis_has_cred
code: khis_has_cred(auth = NULL)

title: Check if DHIS2 Credentials are Available — khis_has_cred
text: auth (Optional) auth object containing DHIS2 credentials. provided, function check global auth object credentials.

title: Check if DHIS2 Credentials are Available — khis_has_cred
text: boolean value indicating whether valid credentials available.

title: Check if DHIS2 Credentials are Available — khis_has_cred
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # Set the credentials using global .auth object     khis_cred(username = 'DHIS2 username',               password = 'DHIS2 password',               server = 'https://dhis2-instance/api')      # Check if credentials are available. Should return TRUE     khis_has_cred()      # Clear global credentials     khis_cred_clear()      # Check if credentials are available. Should return FALSE     khis_has_cred() } # }

title: Retrieve the Configured Username — khis_username
text: function returns username configured credentials. auth object provided, retrieves username object. Otherwise, retrieves username global auth object.

code: khis_username(auth = NULL)

title: Retrieve the Configured Username — khis_username
text: auth (Optional) auth object. provided, function retrieve username global auth credentials.

title: Retrieve the Configured Username — khis_username
text: username string, NULL credentials available.

title: Retrieve the Configured Username — khis_username
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # Set the credentials using global .auth object     khis_cred(username = 'DHIS2 username',               password = 'DHIS2 password',               server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')      # View the username (expect 'DHIS2 username')     khis_username()      # Clear credentials     khis_cred_clear()      # View the username (expect 'NULL')     khis_username() } # }

title: khisr Configuration — khisr-configuration
text: aspects khisr behaviour can controlled via option. Temporarily suppress messages enabling quiet mode within provided code block. Temporarily suppress messages within specified environment.

title: khisr Configuration — khisr-configuration
code: with_khis_quiet(code)  local_khis_quiet(env = parent.frame())

title: khisr Configuration — khisr-configuration
text: code Code execute quietly env environment use scoping.

title: khisr Configuration — khisr-configuration
text: return value, called side effects return value, called side effects return value, called side effects.

title: khisr Configuration — khisr-configuration
text: khis_quiet option can used suppress messages form khisr. default, khisr always messages, .e. quiet. set khis_quiet TRUE suppress message, one means, order decreasing scope: Put options(khis_quiet = TRUE) start-file, .Rprofile,  R script. Use local_khis_quiet() silence khisr specific scope. Use with_khis_quite run small bit code silently. local_khis_quiet with_khis follow conventions withr package.

title: khisr Configuration — khisr-configuration
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # message: "The credentials have been set."     khis_cred(username = 'username',               password = 'password',               server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')      # suppress messages for a small amount of code     with_khis_quiet(         khis_cred(username = 'username',                   password = 'password',                   server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')     ) } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{     # message: "The credentials have been set."     khis_cred(username = 'username',               password = 'password',               server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')      # suppress messages for a in a specific scope     local_khis_quiet()      # no message     khis_cred(username = 'username',               password = 'password',               server = 'https://<dhis2-instance>')      # clear credentials     khis_cred_clear() } # }

what: khisr: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2 — khisr-package
title: khisr: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2 — khisr-package
text: Provides user-friendly interface interacting District Health Information Software 2 (DHIS2) instance. streamlines data retrieval, empowering researchers, analysts, healthcare professionals obtain utilize data efficiently.

title: khisr: An R Client to Retrieve Data from DHIS2 — khisr-package
text: Maintainer: David Kariuki hello@damurka.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: Metadata Filter — metadata-filter
text: Formats metadata filter DHIS 2 comparison operators.

title: Metadata Filter — metadata-filter
code: metadata_filter(property, operator, values, call = caller_env())  property %.eq% values  property %.ieq% values  property %.~eq% values  property %.ne% values  property %.Like% values  property %.~Like% values  property %.^Like% values  property %.~^Like% values  property %.Like$% values  property %.~Like$% values  property %.like% values  property %.~like% values  property %.^like% values  property %.~^like% values  property %.like$% values  property %.~like$% values  property %.gt% values  property %.ge% values  property %.lt% values  property %.le% values  property %.token% values  property %.~token% values  property %.in% values  property %.~in% values

title: Metadata Filter — metadata-filter
text: property property metadata want filter operator comparison operator want perform values value check call description

title: Metadata Filter — metadata-filter
text: spliced list filter format property:operator:value

title: Metadata Filter — metadata-filter
text: filter metadata several filter operations can applied returned list metadata. format filter straight-forward follows pattern property:operator:value, property property metadata want filter , operator comparison operator want perform value value check (operators require value). view operator see DHIS 2 Operator %.eq%        - Equality %.ieq%       - Case insensitive string, match exact %.~eq%       - Inequality %.ne%        - Inequality %.Like%      - Case sensitive string, match anywhere %.~Like%     - Case sensitive string, match anywhere %.^Like%     - Case sensitive string, match start %.~^Like%    - Case sensitive string, match start %.Like$%     - Case sensitive string, match end %.~Like$%    - Case sensitive string, match end %.like%      - Case insensitive string, match anywhere %.~like%     - Case insensitive string, match anywhere %.^like%    - Case insensitive string, match start %.~^like%    - Case insensitive string, match start %.like$%     - Case insensitive string, match end %.~like$%    - Case insensitive string, match end %.gt%        - Greater %.ge%        - Greater equal %.lt%        - Less %.le%        - Less equal %.token%     - Match multiple tokens search property %.~token%    - match multiple tokens search property %.%        - Find objects matching 1 values %.~%       - Find objects matching 1 values

title: Metadata Filter — metadata-filter
code: # Generate an equality filter id %.eq% 'element_id' #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "id:eq:element_id" #>   # Finding multiple ids 'id' %.in% c('id1', 'id2', 'id3') #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "id:in:[id1,id2,id3]" #>   # Get all data elements which have a data set with id ID1 'dataSetElements.dataSet.id' %.eq% 'ID1' #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "dataSetElements.dataSet.id:eq:ID1" #>   # get data elements which are members of the ANC data element group 'dataElementGroups.id' %.eq% 'qfxEYY9xAl6' #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "dataElementGroups.id:eq:qfxEYY9xAl6" #>   # Get data elements which have any option set metadata_filter('optionSet', '!null', NULL) #> <spliced> #> $filter #> [1] "optionSet:!null" #>

title: DHIS2 Metadata Helper Functions — metadata-helpers
text: functions simplify retrieving data specific DHIS2 API endpoints using get_metadata().

title: DHIS2 Metadata Helper Functions — metadata-helpers
code: get_categories(...)  get_category_combos(...)  get_category_option_combos(...)  get_category_option_group_sets(...)  get_category_option_groups(...)  get_category_options(...)  get_data_element_group_sets(...)  get_data_element_groups(...)  get_data_elements(...)  get_data_sets(...)  get_user_groups(...)  get_indicator_group_sets(...)  get_indicator_groups(...)  get_indicators(...)  get_option_group_sets(...)  get_option_groups(...)  get_option_sets(...)  get_options(...)  get_organisation_unit_groupsets(...)  get_organisation_unit_groups(...)  get_organisation_units(...)  get_organisation_unit_levels(...)  get_dimensions(...)  get_period_types(...)  get_user_profile()

title: DHIS2 Metadata Helper Functions — metadata-helpers
text: ... Arguments passed get_metadata fields specific columns returned data frame. retry Number times retry API call case failure (defaults 2). verbosity Level HTTP information print call: 0: output 1: Show headers 2: Show headers bodies 3: Show headers, bodies, CURL status message. timeout Maximum number seconds wait DHIS2 API response. call caller environment

title: DHIS2 Metadata Helper Functions — metadata-helpers
text: tibble containing DHIS2 metadata response.

title: DHIS2 Metadata Helper Functions — metadata-helpers
code: if (FALSE) { # khis_has_cred()  # Get all organisation units get_organisation_units()  # Get all data elements get_data_elements()  # Get data elements by element ids get_data_elements(id %.in% c('VR7vdS7P0Gb', 'gQro1y7Rsbq'))  # Get datasets by name with the word 'MOH 705' get_data_sets(name %.like% 'MOH 705') }

title: khisr 1.0.6
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-06

title: khisr 1.0.6
text: Introduced server argument: server argument now accepts server URL without /api suffix, simplifying configuration DHIS2 credentials API calls.

title: khisr 1.0.6
text: Deprecated base_url khis_cred(): base_url argument now deprecated favour new server argument. Deprecated default base_url value: default value previously used base_url argument longer supported. Users provide explicit server URL moving forward.

title: khisr 1.0.6
text: Improved testing: Test coverage enhanced automatically skip tests target server unreachable , ensuring smoother testing workflows offline server downtime conditions.

title: khisr 1.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2024-06-27 Improved Authentication: Now supports optional authentication API calls using auth argument. strengthens security allowing control access data. Clearer Error Messages: Provides informative error messages help identify troubleshoot issues efficiently.

title: khisr 1.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2024-06-10 khis_has_cred(): Now ensures credentials valid returning TRUE, preventing unauthorized access. khis_cred(): Includes validation accept valid credentials, reducing errors.

title: khisr 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2024-06-08

title: khisr 1.0.3
text: Introduced experimental functions enhanced data retrieval: get_data_elements_with_category_options(): Fetch data elements along associated category option values. get_organisations_by_level(): Retrieve organizations filtered level. get_analytics_by_level(): Obtain analytics table data get_data_sets_by_level(): Retrieve data set reporting rate metrics. Added khis_base_url() obtain DHIS2 API URL. Introduced get_organisation_unit_levels() retrieve available organisation levels DHIS2 instance.

title: khisr 1.0.3
text: Made package generic support DHIS2 instance updated documentation accordingly. Modified khis_cred() require base_url argument deprecated default value.

title: khisr 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-14 Updated khis_cred_clear() reset base_url back KHIS API. Updated khis_cred() allow base_url set config file.

title: khisr 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-05 Initial CRAN submission.
